meanings.definition: A person who is charming or enchanting.
meanings.sent1: The children were delighted by the charmers at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the charmers in the neighborhood due to her friendly nature.
meanings.sent3: The charmers at the circus made everyone smile with their tricks and jokes.
meanings.sent4: His charisma was like that of the charmers in fairy tales, captivating all who met him.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories were like magic spells, turning him into a charmer in the eyes of the listeners.

meanings.definition: An object used to attract or enchant, such as a charm or amulet.
meanings.sent1: She wore a necklace with various charmers hanging from it.
meanings.sent2: The shop displayed a collection of beautiful charmers in the window.
meanings.sent3: The charmers on the bracelet seemed to sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The ancient talisman was believed to be a powerful charmer against evil spirits.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand was his most potent charmer, casting spells with a flick of his wrist.
